وینسینٹ وین گوگ رات کے آسمان سے متاثر تھ: Was Vincent van Gogh inspired by the night sky? Vincent van Gogh night sky inspiration

Observation and Imagination in The Starry Night (1889) “This morning I saw the countryside from my window a long time before sunrise, with nothing but the morning star, which looked very big,” wrote van Gogh to his brother Theo, describing his inspiration for one of his best-known paintings, The Starry Night (1889).
Was Vincent van Gogh inspired by the night sky? Vincent van Gogh night sky inspiration

Inspired by the view from his window at the Saint-Paul-de-Mausole asylum in Saint-Rémy, in southern France, where the artist spent twelve months in 1889–90 seeking reprieve from his mental illnesses, The Starry Night (made in mid-June) is both an exercise in observation and a clear departure from it.
وینسینٹ وین گوگ رات کے رنگوں سے متاثر تھ: Was Vincent van Gogh inspired by the colors of the night? Vincent van Gogh night colors inspiration

Colors of the Night. Throughout his career, Vincent van Gogh (Dutch, 1853–1890) attempted the paradoxical task of representing night by light. His procedure followed the trend set by the Impressionists of “translating” visual light effects with various color combinations.
Was Vincent van Gogh inspired by the colors of the night? Vincent van Gogh night colors inspiration

Citing Van Gogh's avowed admiration for the paintings of Eugène Delacroix, and especially the earlier painter's use of Prussian blue and citron yellow in paintings of Christ, Soth theorizes that Van Gogh used these colors to represent Christ in The Starry Night.
وینسینٹ وین گوگ رات کے ستاروں سے متاثر ت: Was Vincent van Gogh inspired by the stars? Vincent van Gogh inspiration stars

Vincent van Gogh loved the night sky. “For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream,” the Dutch painter wrote in a letter to his brother, Theo, in 1888. It was the year he began painting some of his most famous images of starry skies.
Was Vincent van Gogh inspired by the stars? Vincent van Gogh inspiration stars
